reinsertNode

public boolean reinsertNode(Node n)
Description copied from interface: Graph
Reinserts a node in this graph. Note: A node can belong at any time at most to one primary graph. Whether a graph is primary may be obtained through the Graph.isPrimary() method. So, it this graph is primary, the node must not belong to any primary graph.

Specified by:
reinsertNode in interface Graph
Returns:
true if the node is actually reinserted in the graph (i.e., it was not already there)

reinsertEdge

public boolean reinsertEdge(Edge e)
Description copied from interface: Graph
Reinserts an edge in this graph. Each node of the edge that do not belong to this graph is reinserted to this graph prior to reinserting the edge itself. Note: An edge can belong at any time at most to one primary graph. Whether a graph is primary may be obtained through the Graph.isPrimary() method. So, it this graph is primary, the edge must not belong to any primary graph.

Specified by:
reinsertEdge in interface Graph
Returns:
true if the edge is actually reinserted in the graph (i.e., it was not already there)

importGraph

public void importGraph(Graph g)
Description copied from interface: Graph
Imports all the contents of the specified graph, into this graph. After the successful execution of this method, the specified graph is empty, and all nodes and edges it contained have been inserted to this graph.

Specified by:
importGraph in interface Graph
See Also:
Graph.importGraph(Graph, Iterable)

importGraph

public Collection<Edge> importGraph(Graph g,
                                    Iterable<Node> nodes)
Description copied from interface: Graph
Imports a subpart of the specified graph, into this graph. The subpart is consisted of the nodes specified, and every edge that both its nodes are contained in the group. Every other edge, that connects a node to be imported and a node that will not be removed, is removed and returned as a Collection.

Specified by:
importGraph in interface Graph
Returns:
a collection of edges that have one node that belongs to the declared nodes, and one node that does not belong to them (i.e., inter-edge)

areAdjacent

public boolean areAdjacent(Node n1,
                           Node n2)
Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph
Returns whether there exists an edge connecting the specified nodes. This is equivalent to areAdjacent(n1, n2, Direction.EITHER)

Specified by:
areAdjacent in interface InspectableGraph
See Also:
InspectableGraph.areAdjacent(Node, Node, Direction)

areAdjacent

public boolean areAdjacent(Node n1,
                           Node n2,
                           Direction direction)
Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph
Returns whether there exists an edge connecting the specified nodes, with the specified direction. That is, to return true there must be an edge e such that:
  • If direction is Direction.OUT, e.n1() == n1 && e.n2() == n2
  • If direction is Direction.IN, e.n2() == n1 && e.n1() == n2
  • If direction is Direction.EITHER, e.isIncident(n1) && e.isIncident(n2)

    • Specified by:
    areAdjacent in interface InspectableGraph
    See Also:
    InspectableGraph.areAdjacent(Node, Node, Direction)

    edges

    public ExtendedListIterable<Edge> edges(Node node)
    Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph
    Returns an ExtendedListIterable over all edges that contain the specified node. This is equivalent to edges(node, Direction.EITHER)

    Specified by:
    edges in interface InspectableGraph
    Parameters:
    node - the node that all the returned edges must contain

    edges

    public ExtendedListIterable<Edge> edges(Node n1,
                                        Node n2)
    Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph
    Returns an ExtendedListIterable over all edges that connect the specified nodes, in either direction. This is equivalent to edges(n1, n2, Direction.EITHER).

    Specified by:
    edges in interface InspectableGraph

    adjacentNodes

    public ExtendedListIterable<Node> adjacentNodes(Node n)
    Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph
    Returns an ExtendedListIterable over all nodes that are neighbors with the specified node. Two nodes are "neighbors" if there exists an edge connecting the two. Actually, for every incident edge, a neighbor is reported, so in the case of parallel edges, neighbors are reported multiple times. This is equivalent to adjacentNodes(node, Direction.EITHER)

    Specified by:
    adjacentNodes in interface InspectableGraph
    See Also:
    InspectableGraph.adjacentNodes(Node, Direction)

    Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph

    Specified by:
    degree in interface InspectableGraph

    degree

    public int degree(Node node,
                  Direction direction)
    Description copied from interface: InspectableGraph
    Returns the degree of the specified node, depending on direction:
  • Direction.OUT: equivalent to outDegree(node)
  • Direction.IN: equivalent to inDegree(node)
  • Direction.EITHER: equivalent to degree(node)

    • Specified by:
    degree in interface InspectableGraph
